sentences.english: Many imperial concubines saw the royal concubineses all do like this, in succession quiet to have not another mention what.
sentences.chinese: 衆妃嬪見貴妃都這樣做了，紛紛噤聲沒有再說什麼。

sentences.english: I acquired men and women singers, and a harem as well-the delights of the heart of man.
sentences.chinese: 又得唱歌的男女和世人所喜愛的物，並許多的妃嬪。

sentences.english: There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number.
sentences.chinese: 有六十王后八十妃嬪，並有無數的童女。

sentences.english: Both Internal and External Titled Madams are those concubines of emperors except their empresses.
sentences.chinese: 內命婦，係指皇后以外皇帝的妃嬪而言。

sentences.english: The queens and the concubines, They also praised her.
sentences.chinese: 王后妃嬪見了也讚美她。

definition: to enter the emperor's palace/(slang) to go to jail
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
Emperor Xuan (91-48 BC) of the Former Han Dynasty, reigned 74-48 BC
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
